title: Corbis logo
content:
What is the name of this font?

Take a look at the distinctive R  
The b looks like Bauhaus but the r doesnt. Any sugestions?

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [corbis.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140709161149/http:/typophile.com/files/corbis.gif) | 6.8 KB |
author: studio

comments.content: Looks like a custom logo to me, the way the r hooks up with the b and all. May have been based in part on Handel Gothic too.

Hmm ... maybe but the b comes from another family than Handel Gothic or Bauhaus ... and i must know wich family is that

Thanks pattyfab for infon

[url=http://www.portal.tk][img}http://w.8k.ro/\_temp/www.portal.tk.gif[/img][/url]

Hmm ... maybe but the b comes from another family than Handel Gothic or Bauhaus ... and i must know wich family is that

Thanks pattyfab for infon

Chalet Tokyo from House Industries has a similar b, more so than Bauhaus

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20140709161149/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewfonts "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewfonts")

You should also look at Mike's Bauhaus Font ID Guide

[http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140709161149/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html "http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html")

but I still think it's a logo, not a font.
I think it was done at Segura Inc. (the parent company of T26)
